The highwire Smith is walking was very evident at her party’s AGM this weekend at Edmonton’s Expo Centre. Smith said she wanted to make a breakthrough in Edmonto

articles.title: Airbus orders software fix to thousands of planes due to solar radiation risk
articles.description: The company said it’s taking action because “analysis of a recent event involving an A320 Family aircraft has revealed that intense solar radiation may corrupt data critical to the functioning of flight controls.”

articles.title: Ottawa Senators recall defenceman Dennis Gilbert before facing Dallas Stars
articles.description: They could get winger Ridly Greig back against Dallas, but defenceman Thomas Chabot has been placed on injured reserve.

articles.title: Edmonton could grow to 1.25M people in two years, says administration
articles.description: City council briefed on growth challenges and solutions as part of orientation blitz

articles.title: Black Friday sets online spending record of $11.8B, Adobe says
articles.description: American consumers spent $11.8 billion online on Black Friday, according to data from Adobe Analytics, which says it tracks more than 1 trillion visits to U.S. retail websites.

articles.title: Closures snarl traffic in parts of Highway 417 in Ottawa
articles.description: Three westbound lanes and two on-ramps were closed due to watermain valve repairs.

articles.title: Several properties evacuated after train derailment east of Cranbrook
articles.description: Five properties have been evacuated after several cars derailed from a Canadian Pacific Kansas City train.

articles.title: Adopt-A-School: Let's help Admiral Seymour elementary feed their children in need
articles.description: Sixty per cent of Admiral Seymour elementary school’s families struggle financially and hunger is prevalent.

articles.title: Smith seeks to convince UCP members on merits of Carney pipeline deal
articles.description: UCP party leader and Premier Danielle Smith also pledged a new motion under her government's Sovereignty Act that would mandate non-participation in federal gun seizure program

articles.title: New York state law takes aim at personalized pricing
articles.description: Businesses that use personalized pricing are now required to tell customers, “This price was set by an algorithm using your personal data."

articles.title: Four bears captured in Bella Coola not involved in attack on school children, say conservation officers
articles.description: The Conservation Officer Service says forensic evidence has ruled out the grizzly bears. A search continues for the bears that seriously three students and a teacher last week.

articles.title: One man dead in shooting near Surrey's Guildford mall
articles.description: Surrey police say Friday night's shooting is not related to the recent string of extortion shootings.

articles.title: Ottawa Victims Services awarded funding to promote 'red flag' firearm law awareness
articles.description: The money will be used to the organization's "See it, Name it, Change it" campaign, to get the word out about firearm prohibition orders.

articles.title: A pipeline is just the beginning: More threats coming for Indigenous rights
articles.description: Ottawa’s approach to major infrastructure projects puts Indigenous rights at risk

articles.title: No, you can’t get your AI to ‘admit’ to being sexist, but it probably is anyway
articles.description: Though LLMs might not use explicitly biased language, they may infer your demographic data and display implicit biases, researchers say.

articles.description: Royal Ontario Museum honours benefactor for groundbreaking support of emerging fashion designers and children's charities

articles.title: Canada ranks low on military oversight: study
articles.description: Canada maintains a low level of civilian oversight of the military due to rigid party discipline, according to a new book that compares it with fourteen other democracies.

articles.title: Mariah Carey's ‘All I Want for Christmas Is You’ earns more than US$2.5M a year
articles.description: The song appeared on her fourth studio album, Merry Christmas, and went on to top the charts in 26 countries
